title: The Chef Reclaiming Tex-Mex Says There’s One Secret To Successful Nachos
text:
Los Angeles–based chef Josef Centeno has been pumping out some of the country’s most thoughtful Tex-Mex at Bar Amá and, more recently, Bäco Mercat and Amacita. His flagship restaurant is named after his great-grandmother, whom everyone called Amá and who immigrated to Texas after the Mexican Revolution. By Centeno’s account, she was the sort of matriarch who fed everyone, and what she fed her family was Tex-Mex cuisine. “Simple cooking that wasn’t authentically Mexican but not the melted-cheese-topped stuff people usually talk about when describing Tex-Mex,’’ Centeno writes in the introduction of Amá, his newest cookbook.

description: L.A.’s Josef Centeno reflects on the childhood feasts that inspired his new cookbook Amá
